newsitem.title: HONG KONG: World to see HK sing China praise on handover day.
newsitem.headline: World to see HK sing China praise on handover day.

text.p: A world audience will see a galaxy of Hong Kong and Chinese stars sing China's praises in a gala televised show on the day the British colony reunites with its giant motherland.

The HK$15 million (US$1.9 million) programme at the Hong Kong Coliseum on July 1 will open with a military band playing China's national anthem as the red five-star flag is raised, followed by traditional drummers from the mainland.

A display of Chinese national costumes and Hong Kong fashions will conclude with all performers singing "My Motherland" and the Hong Kong Philharmonic will later perform the symphonic choral work "Praise China".
The organiser, the Association for Celebration of Reunification of Hong Kong with China, said it expected a local audience of 5,000 and a global satellite TV audience of a billion.
"We want to have the whole world experience the artistic spirit of Chinese people from Hong Kong and the mainland performing together," said chief programme director Patrick Ho.

Lest the motherland seem to dominate the evening, Hong Kong martial arts giants such as Jackie Chan and Sammo Hung will join in a Lion Dance, and local Cantonese opera performers and pop music stars will also sing.
"It will be the greatest show that Hong Kong has ever seen," said Ma Fung-kwok, an association official.
The territory of 6.4 million reverts to China at midnight of June 30 after more than 150 years as a British colony.
